intro: Bidens kirkii var. flagellata, commonly known as the whipweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features small, yellow flowers with ray florets and a distinctive, slender stem. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
